content.description: Climb up the left edge of the broad orange and black buttress on the vegetated terrace (Upper Tier) above the Grotto and west of the Java Wall. Climb the left most route, on steep featured rock, passing interesting pockets along the edge of the buttress to a final steep bulge. "Welcome to Echo" is sustained and pumpy from the bottom to the top. There is no distinct crux.
content.location: Located on The Upper Tier, scramble up the gully left of the arete of "Bushed Coyote." Short, but rather unpleasant.

content.description:
"Walter" climbs the right side of the broad orange and black streaked buttress between "Sasha" and "Puppy Feet."

Pull over the initial bulge on pockets, side-pulls, and small positive features. Continue up the steep orange face on small positive features and an assortment of small 2-finger pockets to a final bulge. At the top mantle onto a wide ledge and the anchors.
content.location: 40 feet to the right of "Welcome to Echo." "Walter" begins at a wide rocky flat spot below a small overlap.

content.description: Sasha begins 15ft right (east) of "Reverb" (5.10a) on the Upper Tier. The route starts with a deep two finger pocket and a large melon-sized pocket beneath a small black overhang. The route ascends the steep orange and black face on positive, but sharp edges, and a variety of small pockets past 6 bolts. Pass the black overhang (& 6th bolt) on the left via a shallow featured seam.

"Reverb" is the right of two bolted lines that begin from a blocky pedestal at the left end of the highest level of the terrace of the Upper Tier. Climb up the groove on somewhat loose and flaky orange rock. While it is possible to power up the bolt line from the base to the anchor, a more thoughtful, circuitous route is possible utilizing pockets and cobbles below and to the right of the bolts. "Reverb" is well protected and should clean up nicely with more ascents.
content.location: Located on the Upper Tier, above the Grotto. "Reverb" is the third route from the left, between "Welcome to Echo" and "Sasha."

content.description:
"Puppy Feet" climbs the right side of the orange and black streaked buttress right of "Welcome to Echo Cliffs," "Sasha," and "Walter."

Start just left of the black water streak/gully and climb pockets and small positive features past five bolts to a 2-ring anchor at a wide ledge.
content.location: Right side of the broad orange and black streaked buttress of the Upper Tier, above the Grotto. Start 15 feet right of "Walter" and just left of the black water streak/crack/gully.

content.description: "Man's Best Friend" climbs a gently overhanging buttress utilizing small pockets, edges, and crimps. Begin below a narrow ledge 8 ft above the base, mantle the ledge and continue pulling small pockets and features past a shallow horizontal. Above the horizontal pull onto the steep upper headwall on crimps to a large flat cobble. Continue up and left above the cobble to the anchors.
content.location: Right-most route on The Upper Tier. Walk east, along the base, until below a series of ledges 8-10 feet above the ground. Begin below the ledges on the steep orange buttress between shallow black water streaks.

content.description: Begin in the middle of the narrow orange buttress. Pull up onto the slab on horizontals and pockets. Continue up the slab, using pockets and the right arete. At the top of the slab clip the 3rd bolt and move left to the steep face on knobs and small features. Continue up the face above past two more bolts.

"Doggie Style" climbs a steep narrow buttress on small pockets and features. Mantle onto the narrow ledge at ten feet and clip the 1st bolt. Pull up onto a small sloping shelf on small pockets and climb the steepening face on small features and pockets over a final bulge to the anchors.
content.location: Begin 8 feet right of "Puppy Feet," just right of the dark black water streak. 60 feet right of "Welcome to Echo," between "Puppy Feet" and "Man's Best Friend."

content.description: "Blackie" climbs up the right side of the face, left of the crack/gully, and 30 feet left of "Welcome to Echo." Begin climbing below an arching, left facing, crescent shaped flake where the rock changes from tan to black. Climb up the flake on side-pulls, edges, and small pockets on wonderful black rock. From the top of the flake move up and right on horizontals and pockets. Higher pull through a bulge and continue to the top, and the anchor, on positive edges and pockets. In case you're wondering the name memorializes a former dog companion as does Sasha and Walter.
content.location: This is right-most of three routes on the black and tan face of the western-most buttress of The Upper Tier.

content.description: Climb the steep tan face below the pillar utilizing a variety of pockets and positive features. Continue up the face of the narrow pillar to its top. Mantle onto the pillar and climb the overhanging headwall above on side-pulls and positive edges to the anchor.
content.location: Middle line of bolts on the western-most buttress of The Upper Tier.

content.description: Climb the face just left of the crack/gully on positive edges and pockets. The 4th bolt is on the right wall of the crack/gully. Continue up and right on positive features. Cross the crack/gully to the anchor on the left side of the pillar.
content.location: Left-most route on the black and tan face of the western-most buttress of The Upper Tier.
